title: Chelsea star Fikayo Tomori remembers how he broke Diego Costa’s nose in training
text:
Tomori once broke Costa’s nose in training (Picture: Getty)

Fikayo Tomori may be enjoying a break-out season for Chelsea, but the 21-year-old once risked the wrath of Diego Costa when he broke the striker’s nose in training.

The centre-back was only 18 when he clashed with Chelsea’s former talisman, a notorious hothead, during a session at Cobham.

Tomori faced a wave of messages and taunts from his team-mates after the incident and was relieved Costa decided against taking revenge.

He said: ‘I was still in school and I didn’t know I had done it in training. It was an accident.

Costa was forced to wear a face mask after the clash of heads (Picture: Getty)

‘We both went up for a header, I had to flick the ball backwards and he tried to score.

‘He headed the back of my head and broke his nose.

‘I didn’t know I had done it until the next day when it was all over the papers.

‘I was getting a lot of messages like I meant to do it, but it was alright.

‘He didn’t kick me in training after that. I got a little bit of stick. It was light hearted, a lot of banter.

Tomori was called up to the England squad last week (Picture: Getty)

‘I got back to school and people were asking about it. My mates had all seen it.’

Tomori is in line to make his debut for England after accepting a call-up from Gareth Southgate.

The defender was also eligible to play for Canada and spoke to his family before making the decision to link up with England.
